title: Nuremburg Chronicle
content:
Apologises if this has been posted before. While hunting headless men I found this beautiful resource. Large scans, page by page of this illustrated and hand-scribed book.

[http://daten.digitale-sammlungen.de/~db/0003/bsb00034024/images/index.html?id=00034024&fip=196.210.192.101&no=48&seite=1](http://web.archive.org/web/20100131102237/http:/daten.digitale-sammlungen.de/~db/0003/bsb00034024/images/index.html?id=00034024&fip=196.210.192.101&no=48&seite=1)

It seems to be the full book, I haven't gone through all the pages yet though. And there's a mention of a PDF download - but it's all German to me. :)

Read more about the book here:

[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nuremberg\_Chronicles](http://web.archive.org/web/20100131102237/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nuremberg_Chronicles)

-Rudolf
author: rvavruch

comments.content:
<cite>â€™s all German to me</cite>

Well the book is actually in Latin, at least the pages I looked at.  
Get the English download link here:  
 [http://mdz10.bib-bvb.de/zend-bsb/pdf\_download.pl](http://web.archive.org/web/20100131102237/http:/mdz10.bib-bvb.de/zend-bsb/pdf_download.pl "http://mdz10.bib-bvb.de/zend-bsb/pdf\_download.pl")

The whole d/l is 349 MB

You can get more details here:  
 [http://www.beloit.edu/nuremberg/inside/contents/index.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20100131102237/http:/www.beloit.edu/nuremberg/inside/contents/index.htm "http://www.beloit.edu/nuremberg/inside/contents/index.htm")

And there is another copy of the book online:  
 [http://www.obrasraras.usp.br/obras/000192/](http://web.archive.org/web/20100131102237/http:/www.obrasraras.usp.br/obras/000192/ "http://www.obrasraras.usp.br/obras/000192/")
Thanks for the links, I meant the website (and the PDF download instructions) were in German. :)
You get them in English when you click on the Union Jack (or follow the link I gave you). Andreas
